an1.219:1.1: “The foremost of my monk disciples who are very learned is Ānanda.
an1.220:1.1: … with a good memory is Ānanda.
an1.221:1.1: … with an extensive range is Ānanda.
an1.223:1.1: … as a personal attendant is Ānanda.
an1.224:1.1: … with a large congregation is Kassapa of Uruvelā.
an1.225:1.1: … who inspire lay families is Kāḷudāyī.
an1.227:1.1: … who recollect past lives is Sobhita.
an1.228:1.1: … who have memorized the monastic law is Upāli.
an1.229:1.1: … who advise the nuns is Nandaka.
an1.230:1.1: … who guard the sense doors is Nanda.
an1.231:1.1: … who advise the monks is Mahākappina.
an1.232:1.1: … who are skilled in the fire element is Sāgata.
an1.233:1.1: … who inspire eloquent teachings is Rādha.
an1.234:1.1: … who wear coarse robes is Mogharājā.”
